One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big pit with lots of sand in it. Tim saw a sleepy cat lying in the pit. He wanted to play with the cat.
"Mom, can I feed the cat?" Tim asked. "Yes, but be careful," his mom said. Tim took some food from his bag and went to the pit. But the cat didn't want to

might be broken."
Tim didn't listen to his mom. He climbed up the slide and peeked at the top. He saw that the slide was really broken! There was a big hole in the middle. Tim was scared, but he thought of an idea.
He called out to his mom, "Mom, can you help me fix the slide?" His mom smiled and said, "Of course, Tim. Let's do it together." They found some wood and fixed the slide. Now, all the kids could play on the slide again. Tim was happy that he listened to his mom and they had fun at the park

said, "Tom, please help! My pipe is broken and water is everywhere!" Tom wanted to help Sue, so he grabbed his tools and went to her house.
At Sue's house, Tom saw the broken pipe. He worked hard to fix it. Sue said, "Thank you, Tom! You bring happiness to our village." Tom smiled and went back to his house, feeling happy that he could help.

Tim and Sue woke up and smelled something bitter. They ran to the kitchen and saw their mom holding a burnt waffle. She looked sad and said, "I'm sorry, kids. The waffle maker is broken. It printed a big X on the waffle and made it black and bitter. We can't eat this."
Tim and Sue felt sorry for their mom and for the waffle. They hugged her and said, "It's okay, mom. We can eat something else. Maybe we can have toast or cereal or eggs."
Their mom smiled and said, "Thank you, kids. You are very sweet

the ground, its leg was broken. Jane gasped in shock.
The ant was scared and started to cry. Jane wanted to help, so she ran back to her house. She grabbed a bandaid, and ran back to the park. The ant was so happy when she saw Jane and the bandaid!
Jane gently picked up the ant and used the bandaid to put its leg back together. In no time, the ant was able to hop away happily.
Jane smiled and said, "See, your leg is all better now."

play with. One day, the barrel became broken, and Bobo was very sad.
Bobo's friend, Toto the turtle, saw that Bobo was sad. Toto wanted to help fix the broken barrel. Toto had an idea! He would borrow some tape from his friend Dodo the duck to fix the barrel.
Toto went to Dodo's house and asked, "Can I borrow some tape to fix Bobo's broken barrel?" Dodo said, "Yes, of course!" Toto took the tape and went back to Bobo's house. Together, they fixed the broken barrel.

couldn't believe that the fountain was broken. He wanted to fix it, but he didn't know how. He looked around and saw a few kids carrying a big bag with them. He went over to them and asked what was in the bag.
The kids explained that they had taken some tools from their dad's garage to fix the fountain. They said they could fix it if Andrew helped them! Andrew was so excited that he helped the kids repair the fountain. After they had finished, the fountain was as good as new!

Tom felt sad. He loved his doll. His doll was a gift from his elderly grandma. She made the stitch for him when he was torn.
"My doll is not ugly," Tom said to Sara. "He has a stitch because he is brave. He is special."
Sara did not listen. She grabbed Tom's doll and ran away. She wanted to open the stitch and see what was inside.

Tom and Jen cry. The big boy laughs.
"Ha ha, your car is broken! You can't play with it anymore!" he says.
He walks away. He does not care.
Tom and Jen look at the broken car. They feel bad.
"We worked so hard to make it!" Jen says.
"I know, Jen, it was our car!" Tom says.
They hug each other. They are still friends.

Her dad helped her to get started. Sarah put her hand on the wall and began to walk. As she moved around, she noticed something strange. Every wall she touched felt broken or muddy. 
Sarah stopped and turned to her dad. "Is this a secret maze?" she asked. 
Her dad smiled. "Yes, Sarah," he said. "at the end, there's a special surprise waiting for you."

Sam and Mia were friends who liked to play outside. One night, they saw a bright light in the sky. It was a comet, a big rock that flies very fast.
"Wow, look at that!" Sam said. "It is so shiny and pretty!"
"I wish I could hop on it and see where it goes," Mia said. "Maybe it goes to other planets with funny animals and plants."
They ran to the hill and tried to hop as high as they could. They pretended they were astronauts, exploring the space.
